required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation Of Caudal Epidural Anatomy By Ultrasonography İn Pediatric Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation Of Caudal Epidural Anatomy By Ultrasonography İn Pediatric Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Detailed study of ultrasonographic caudal epidural anatomy

detailed_description.textblock: Caudal epidural block is one of the most common methods to provide analgesia for an infraumbilical surgery in children. Although it can be carried out safely and easily, many complications have been described so far, because of inaccurate needle injections. To perform a successful block, a good caudal epidural anatomic assessment is essential. Ultrasonography is an important tool to perform pediatric regional blocks, including caudal blocks. We believe that caudal epidural ultrasound evaluation can be an important option to decrease complications and to achieve a successful attempt; due to that we will try to describe caudal epidural ultrasound imaging and changes from one month to 84 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Definition Of Dural Sac Termination Level By Ultrasonography
primary_outcome.description: After general anesthesia, patient will be placed in lateral decubitus position. First, a 12 MHz lineer ultrasound transducer will be placed transversely to obtain the transverse view of sacral hiatus; in this view we will try to show two sacral cornua, sacrococcygeal ligament, posterior sacral bone and caudal epidural depth. Secondly, transducer will be turned parallel to the midline or paravertebral to obtain longitudinal view; in longitudinal view we will try to obtain the images of sacral vertebral corpuses, caudal epidural area and dural sac. We will try to determine the level of dural sac termination according to a part of vertabral corpus or an intervertebral distance.

primary_outcome.measure: Distance Between Dural Sac Termination Level And Placement Of Caudal Epidural Needle
primary_outcome.description: Distance Between Dural Sac Termination Level And Placement Of Caudal Epidural Needle will be measured under longitudinal ultrasound view

primary_outcome.measure: Determination Of Optimal Needle Angle For Caudal Epidural Block By Ultrasonography
primary_outcome.description: Determination of optimal needle Angle for caudal epidural block will be measured under longitudinal ultrasound view

primary_outcome.measure: Definition Of Average Caudal Epidural Depth By Ultrasonography
primary_outcome.description: Definition of caudal epidural depth by ultrasonography will be obtained under transverse view for every patient and average value will be defined for every age group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination Of Sacral Cornua As An Anatomic Landmark And Confirmation By Ultrasonography
secondary_outcome.description: Sacral cornua will be palpated and than will be scanned under transverse ultrasound view. Also results will be compared.

arm_group.description: Caudal Epidural Ultrasonography will be performed in patients aged between 1-24 months
Caudal Epidural Ultrasonography will be performed in patients aged between 25-48 months
Caudal Epidural Ultrasonography will be performed in patients aged between 49-84 months

study_pop.textblock: Pediatric patients who are admitted to operating room for any pediatric surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric patients who applied for any pediatric surgery from 20 january to 20 july
Exclusion Criteria:
- Premature patients
- Patients who have any sendromic diagnosis
- Patients who have any musculoskeletal abnormalities
- Patients who have any spinal abnormalities
